item.description:
Welcome to yet another thrilling Nerd Fun snob endeavor, in the heart of intellectual snobbery, Harvard Sq! Be there or be Sq.

Humor in good taste: ALLOWED. Intellectual apparel: allowed. Startle the waitstaff with a fake mustache, goatee, periwig, or monocle. Fold-up sunglasses, turtlenecks, corduroy jackets w/ elbow patches: allowed. No Meerschaum tabacco pipes please. Absinthe is not served.

You don't have to be a genuine Intellectual snob to join. Pseudo-intellectuals are also welcome. All you need is an aloof attitude full of irony and some baffling intellectual ideas or--dare I say it--some unanswered question you wish to convey incognito.

Grendel's is a very popular Snob venue during Happy Hour and they offer a half off food special from 5 to 7:30, with the purchase of a $3 drink!

But you need to get there on time: finding a seat later can be a troublesome affair. So help nab tables & get your order in while the waitstaff are waiterly-- they get busy quickly.   

HERE IS A THEME IF YOU WANT ONE: Society is founded on innovation. Without which, nothing new could ever evolve.
When I was in college, my Sociology prof said: people pride themselves on individuality. I was stunned, because, I believed (& still do) that most folks strive for conformity.
Are people really naturally creative? If so, how come we dont come across pink houses, purple pants, and eggplants instead of pumpkins on everyones porches this October?

The concept = to share your intellectual baffling snob idea or question on a name tag (provided) and attach such tag to your shirt, OR chuck such idea or question in a basket in our midst which will be provided and passed around (please pass it around!).

Once this deed is done, pluck from the basket & discuss, if appropriate. This may lead to much laughter, but others may be baffled & perhaps enlightened.

 

Please bring cash.

When settling the bill, make sure and add 25% of what you are spending for tax and gratuity!

Street parking: unrestricted in Harvard Square Sunday, but still a bit tricky. Or you can park at the nearby Charles Hotel Parking Garage which seems to offer the most reasonable rates hence popular with Snobs.
item.name: Intellectual Snob Meetup: Innovation vs. Conformity
